hook.text: A man walks to the kitchen, makes a sandwich, eats it, and returns to bed. In the morning, he remembers nothing.

buildup.text: Parasomnias are abnormal behaviors during sleep â€” sleepwalking, sleep talking, night terrors, and sleep eating.

discovery.text: They occur when the brain gets stuck between sleep stages â€” partly awake, partly asleep, with incomplete awareness.

twist.text: Night terrors differ from nightmares. The person screams and thrashes but is actually in deep sleep, not dreaming.

climax.text: Most parasomnias are harmless and common in children. In adults, they may signal stress, sleep deprivation, or disorder.

punchline.text: Parasomnias happen when the brain can't decide if it's awake or asleep.

quiz.question: When do parasomnias occur?
options: When the brain gets stuck between sleep stages
Only when fully awake and conscious
